pr_title: Update Groovy Wrapper, make Java 8 warning milder, and add `groovyw module init`

timeline.bodyText:
If it is only a milder message, why still printing it out as Styel.FailureHeader - how about an orange/yellow warning instead?
Also, I'm not sure we actually still need this. We can set the source and target language level, and I think compiling with Gradle will spit out any errors in that regard..
See https://docs.gradle.org/current/userguide/java_plugin.html#sec:java-extension
// Set the expected module Java level (can use a higher Java to run, but should not use features from a higher Java)
sourceCompatibility = 1.8
targetCompatibility = 1.8
timeline.author: skaldarnar

replies.bodyText:
Yeah, we're setting that compatibility target in all the java projects. Sometimes through indirect reference to common.gradle, but it should still be true.
The one documented case of a java 11 failure we've found is that thing we had with Ubuntu's openjdk distribution the other day. If we do keep a warning like this (and I'm not sure we should; it will be a false positive for the many working java 11 builds), it should have a link to our troubleshooting page.
replies.author: keturn

replies.bodyText: Updated 👍 Screenie on Discord. Went with a Java > 11 warning

timeline.bodyText:
I'd like to vote for more concise logging messages:

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                            println "Doing a default module init - simply fetching CoreSampleGameplay without dependencies in source (same as `groovyw module get CoreSampleGameplay`)"
          
          
            
                            println "[init] Checkout default module distribution"
          
      
    
    
  

More details should appear in groovyw usage.
Also, why did you choose to go for get and not recurse for CoreSampleGameplay. In the end, this is for developers, and we have convenience to keep modules up-to-date: groovyw module update-all

Applied all the logging improvements, thanks for the suggestions! Those were drafts at best :)
As for get vs recurse I wanted to keep out unneeded source unless the dev wants it - really the docs could just say to use groovyw module get|recurse X as desired. groovy module init would otherwise be about the same as init iota?
In any case I'm still not sure what to really think about the default init vs just the distros

timeline.bodyText: Aren't Java 1.8 and Java 9 != JavaVersion.VERSION_11? 🧐 Did you test that with Java 8 and 9?
timeline.author: skaldarnar

replies.bodyText:
it's probably fine — maybe even better — to support 8 or 11, instead of 8–11.
9 and 10 weren't long-term releases. 10 hasn't been maintained for a year and a half by this point.
